Complex eigenvalues/vectors

$Av_i = \lambda_i v_i$

Remember, we write complex eigenvectors as $u + iv$
So $A(u+iv) = Au + iAv = (au-bv) + i(bu + av)$
So
$Au = au - bv$
$Av = bu + av$

$A \matrixstart u & v \matrixend = \matrixstart au - bv & bu + av \matrixend$

$P = \matrixstart u & v \matrixend \matrixstart a & b \\ -b & a \matrixend$

This looks similar to $R(-\theta)$

$A = P \matrixstart a & b \\ -b & a \matrixend P^{-1} = \matrixstart u & v \matrixend \matrixstart a & b \\ -b & a \matrixend {\matrixstart u & v \matrixend} ^{-1}$

Normalizing the $a,b$ matrix allows us to find a rotation-dilation matrix.
